court: HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT CHANDIGARH *** CWP No. 10868 of 1992. Date of decision: July 08, 2013. *** Ashok Kumar Sharma Vs. The State of Haryana and others. *** CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE DR. BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON *** Present: Shri V.K.Jindal, Advocate, for the petitioners. Shri Rajiv Kataria, Sr. D.A.G. Haryana. DR. BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON, J (ORAL) Learned counsel for the petitioners states that the selection of Taxation Inspectors (respondents No. 5 to 101) which has been impugned in this writ petition, has already been quashed by their Lordships of the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India and sequelly this petition has become infructuous. Learned counsel for the State of Haryana concedes this fact and has stated that this petition be disposed of as having become infructuous. In view of the fact that the impugned selection has already been quashed by the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India, no cause of action survives in favour of the petitioners. Consequently, the writ petition has become infructuous and is dismissed as such. July 08, 2013 (DR.BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON) MALIK

judgment_text:
HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT CHANDIGARH *** CWP No. 10868 of 1992. Date of decision: July 08, 2013. *** Ashok Kumar Sharma Vs. The State of Haryana and others. *** CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE DR. BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON *** Present: Shri V.K.Jindal, Advocate, for the petitioners. Shri Rajiv Kataria, Sr. D.A.G. Haryana. DR. BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON, J (ORAL) Learned counsel for the petitioners states that the selection of Taxation Inspectors (respondents No. 5 to 101) which has been impugned in this writ petition, has already been quashed by their Lordships of the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India and sequelly this petition has become infructuous. Learned counsel for the State of Haryana concedes this fact and has stated that this petition be disposed of as having become infructuous. In view of the fact that the impugned selection has already been quashed by the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India, no cause of action survives in favour of the petitioners. Consequently, the writ petition has become infructuous and is dismissed as such. July 08, 2013 (DR.BHARAT BHUSHAN PARSOON) MALIK

JUDGE
